meanings.sent1: The directrices of the school emphasize kindness and respect.
meanings.sent2: Following the directrices of the recipe ensures a delicious outcome.
meanings.sent3: The directrices of the road sign were clear: stop and yield.
meanings.sent4: She followed the directrices of her grandmother's wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The directrices of honesty and integrity should always be upheld.

meanings.definition: A line along which something moves or is aimed
meanings.sent1: The directrices of the laser beam were precise and accurate.
meanings.sent2: The directrices of the missile guided it to its target.
meanings.sent3: The directrices of the dance routine led the performers gracefully.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as directrices, guiding her decisions.
meanings.sent5: The directrices of the river flow determined its course.

meanings.definition: A woman who directs or controls an organization or activity
meanings.sent1: The directrices of the company made strategic decisions.
meanings.sent2: She was the directrices behind the successful event planning.
meanings.sent3: The directrices of the fashion show ensured everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent4: As the directrices of the team, she led with confidence.
meanings.sent5: The directrices of the play directed the actors with precision.
